conclusion: Objects A and B move through the air and are placed down at the location of objects C, D, E, F due to gravity.
The two pieces (A and B) will fall under gravity.
A and B will collide with the blocks that are already standing on the table (C, D on the left; E, F on the right).
Each cloth drapes over the pair of blocks beneath it.
The cloths finally come to rest on the tabletop.
The cloths conform to the shapes of the obstacles without knocking them over or sliding away.
